isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CLUTCH CONTROL LINKAGE - 3700 AND 3800 SERIES - REPLACEMENT - RELAY SHAFT BUSHING

step1.para: Disconnect the upper and lower clutch rods from the relay levers by removing the cotter and clevis pins.
Remove the relay shaft bolts, the lock- washers and flat washers.
Remove the relay shaft and remove the relay lever (bellcrank) assembly and bushings.
Discard the old bushings. Inspect the relay shaft and relay lever (bellcrank) assembly and replace if worn or damaged. Replace the clutch rod clevis pins, if worn.
Lubricate inside and outside of the new bushings with grease. Use Fleetrite EP2 grease or an equivalent NLGI #2 multi-purpose lithium grease.
Position the bushings in the relay lever (bellcrank) assembly.
Position the relay lever (bellcrank) assembly between cab longitudinal sill and the relay shaft bracket. Install the relay shaft.
Install the flat washers, lock washers and relay shaft bolts. Tighten bolts to 50 to 60 ft-lbs. (68 to 81 N•m). Be sure the relay lever assembly pivots freely after tightening bolts.
Connect the upper and lower clutch rods to the relay levers and install new cotter pins. Lubricate clevis pins with a light coat of grease.
Lubricate the relay lever assembly through the lubrication fitting.
Check the clutch control adjustments and readjust as needed.
